Key Match Events: England's spinners, particularly Rashid, created a mid-innings squeeze
Moeen Ali was caught for 5 runs
Pre-Game Insights: England were criticized for retaining their batting order against Ireland
Stokes was brought back into the T20 side and will have to bowl/field his socks off
Adil Rashid was expected to shrug off indifferent form and shine
Post-Match Reflections: England kept T20 World Cup hopes alive with victory over New Zealand
Jos Buttler was player of the match
Miscellaneous Highlights: The crowd was a mix of New Zealanders and Australians
England's quicks fared better than New Zealand's spinners
New Zealand's fast bowlers struggled, going for more than 40 runs from their four overs
Others: The game was played at the Gabba in Brisbane
New Zealand still needed to beat Ireland to finish top of the group
England can finish second if they beat Sri Lanka, but could be pushed to third if Australia can beat Afghanistan by enough to make up a net run rate deficit
